website_summaries.verdict: A secure fit, easy operation, and a bass-forward sound signature make the Powerbeats Pro ideal true wireless earphones for Beats fans.
pros: Powerful audio performance with intense bass depth and bright highs

customer_reviews.title: Worth the wait!
customer_reviews.text: Having owned the last 4 pairs of Powerbeats - I’m an avid gym goer - I find these are An absolute dream. No wires, intuitive controls and AMAZING sound. Being a musician and somewhat of an audiophile, I do like a high sound quality running through my ears, these don’t disappoint. Though not true audiophile headphones, for a truly wireless set they are heavenly. Bass response is still in your face but has been tuned slightly to be more ‘grown up’ sounding, trebles sing and mids are nice and pronounced. Perfect for gym, travelling, moving and just listening in general. If you like Beats or want a fun, excitable sound with a dead secure fit, these are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dom Meakins

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not friendly for smaller ears, 4 tips included but poor passive NC, avg sound quality, not worth it's money even for gym goers, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too mush hype. Not enough quality
customer_reviews.text: Really was excited to get these but what a disappointment. Sound is very tinny and there is no noise cancellation at all which means I can hardly hear my music when at the gym. Sent back for a refund
customer_reviews.author: LucasMilo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t sound as good as airpods
customer_reviews.text: Great looking and stylish headphones and comfortable to wear, i bought these to replace my apple airpods as didn’t feel safe and secure in ears but these new powerbeats pro are nowhere near the quality of sound as airpods as airpods sound amazing have deep rich bass ect where the powerbeats pro sound tinny and not enough bass so i have gave 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: After owning many beats products through the years (as technology improves), I am once again very happy with this newest headphones reinvention. As always the build quality is second to none and is very easy on the eye. The only downside at the moment is the hefty price tag, but as always it will come down if you have more patience than me!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Whitrid

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish 1 earphone desyncs all the time and now only one is working at all
customer_reviews.text: Rubbish as I was really happy with my powerbeats3 - the best wireless earphones for the workout this one is comple waste of money . Started with contant desyncing of one of my earbuds I had to reset them every week and as of today after 2 months of usage the left one completely stopped working and I could only hear music from right earbud - ever resetting them didnt help now . everything is charged etc checked with chat support and sending them back to Apple now so now I am left without music during my exercises for coup;e weeks I guess .
customer_reviews.author: Grzegorz

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful reliability like previous wireless beats dont buy
customer_reviews.text: These are i am afraid as unreliable as the previous generation of wireless beats. I once returned a pair of those 3 times in a year. They were dreadful. eventually the year warranty runs out and thats that. I have had these only 4 months. after a few weeks of repeated disconnection they failed to charge. It took 2 weeks to receive a box to return them to apple. They replaced a faulty left earpiece. Dont be tempted they are unreliable many gym friends say exactly the same. Rubbish expensive and once the one year warranty wears out thats that. ie £ 20 a month for a year for a set of headphones that you then have to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor46

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Ear bud / generic gear are a must for me as a professional gardener I spend hours on my own listening to music while I work, I have bought a succession of Bose/apple/B&O products and have found them wanting. But not any more these are EXACTLY what I have been looking for, great sound, superbly designed, excellent battery life. Most importantly they stay in your ear while your contortions as a gardener get you in all kinds of yoga moves. I feel it’s been worth the wait & I am glad that I preserved in seeking out the best available.
customer_reviews.author: greenkingfish

customer_reviews.title: Slow start but so far so good
customer_reviews.text: This product fits really well and was really excited when I recieved it. I used it around the house for an hour and the sound was really good. The first time I took it for a run I had a lot of problems, with constant cut outs and jitters e.t.c. Initially I thought it was the device and was really disappointed. Was about to return it and thought I'd give it a second chance, the second time I took it for a run I tried a different audio source and it worked really well without any issues. So far good, let's see how I get on.
customer_reviews.author: Ayaz Ali

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Yes they are expensive but I have tried lots of different cheaper versions and they just don't fit properly and there sound was tinny compared to the Powerbeats Pro. These fit me perfectly and the sound is amazing. I use these for running and going to the gym. They are the best earphones I have ever owned so for me I didn't mind paying the high price because I have finally found a product that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: JCM 9

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for outdoor use - a cautionary tale
customer_reviews.text: First up; great sound. Can’t fault it. That’s displaced however by the durability. I used the Powerbeats for outdoor running, which sometimes involves the beats coming into contact with rainwater. They’re supposed to be IPX4 rated which protects against water splash from all directions, yet within a month the product had developed a fault which Apple told me was “corrosion caused by water damage” which invalidates the warranty. I would not recommend using them outdoor. And be careful not to sweat too much either..
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I really like these as they are very comfortable for running. Unfortunately I’ve had issues charging them and now the right earpiece won’t charge anymore. The only option to check the charging is working is to open the case near my phone which should automatically connect, this only works occasionally so is very frustrating and the battery widget doesn’t always update with the current information on which earpiece is charging. Looking online a lot of people have the same problem so not recommended until they sort these issues out.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Shawcross

customer_reviews.title: Stable but can lead pain of ears after wearing long time
customer_reviews.text: I like its steady, sharp style and long battery life! Btw, the sound is also good with short delay. But the bump beside the bud, where there is a attachment sensor, always made my ears painful after several-hours wearing. So It's not so suitable for study wearing (at least not too long), but totally a right stuff for exercising! My pair is 'like new', which save me a lot of money, and also in good quality. One problem I'm not sure whether is because of it is that the music can be discontinuous occasionly. Most likely It's the problem of my phone or the Apple Music, since it also occurred on my previous earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Logic

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I’ve bought expensive ear buds and I love them. Perfect for traveling, working out, cycling etc. They feel very secure in the ear and are easy to operate. The only issue is if the volume is above a certain level other people can hear your music too, so annoying. Also a little fiddly to get in the ear and takes a few goes to work out how to put them back in their case. Fantastic battery life though and they feel comfortable to wear for long periods of time. Very good sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: I❤️RobertSmith

customer_reviews.title: MUST try all the buds
customer_reviews.text: When I received the earphones I was initially very dismayed about the sound quality. After searching online I found a recommendation to try all 3 additional bud sizes if quality was bad. I did this and the quality improved 10 fold - I was so happy with the quality after fitting the larger buds, lots of base and good depth to the sound. In addition these are the only earphones I have EVER used that stay in my ears when running and sweating. The ONLY ones. I am very happy I forked out for these 'phones, they are GREAT for runners.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Stays put in ear & good bass quality but randomly losses contact despite phone being on my person
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had real problems finding something practical that stays in ears and has good sound quality. Although pricey, these stay put when hats/sunglasses etc on/ off & good bass sound As around back of ear, fits in my abnormally small ear canal Only niggle is that it does suddenly pause & only getting my phone out & restating will sort it out again. Frustrating but as stays put in my ear, I will live with that niggle
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M.

customer_reviews.title: That sound quality bro. Damn.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are... overpriced af. But damn they look cool and that sound quality is on par with professional sounding over ear headphones. These are the goats bro i swear. I've worn these for sometimes a 12 hour day at work listening to music and podcasts, and they're comfy as Hell and they won't be falling out your ear at all. Mess around with the tips though, finding the right one for your inner ear makes a difference it literally gets that premium noise cancellation and makes it all sound clearer and better for sure. Dre you've unlocked that premium sound for sure
customer_reviews.author: Louis Lehane

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Been using these since they were released and love how they fit and sound. Worn 3-4 times a week for gym sessions that last a couple of hours at at time. They stay in place really well and you forget that they are in. The sound quality is great and the quick charge o3s brilliant so even if I forget to charge them up I can get a good charge whilst driving on the way to the gym. These aren't the cheapest headphones on the market and I did consider the Jabra's as they also look good but these looked like they are more likley to stay in place due to the fin that goes behind the ear.
customer_reviews.author: j.c.moore

customer_reviews.title: Better products out there
customer_reviews.text: They look stylish and the sound isn't bad, nowhere near as good as other brands though. My real beef is around the inflexible way to charge the ear pods. After 2 weeks use I can no longer charge the ear pods, the plastic charging case refuses to get power from several combinations of leads and power supplies. TBH, these a gimmicky and severely over-priced. I now own £219 worth of unusable plastic! The on-line Beats support site is useless and there is nothing helpful via Google. What an utter waste of cash!
customer_reviews.author: A Woodhall

customer_reviews.title: Sound is so low qulity
customer_reviews.text: For their price I would expect at lest airpods quality. But stock headphones in box with iPhone making an actually good sound, this one is a bad joke. Especially for me - I'm listening metal workout in gym. They no no low sounds like at all
customer_reviews.author: Nikolay

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Every day that I use them I have the same issue, one of the buds doesn’t turn on when placed in the ear, and is worthless until put back in the case and reset. I am utterly sick of this now and they are the most unreliable electronic item I own.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Le Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: As others said not great for small ears 👂
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of things I like about these headphones - you can skip/pause tracks and control the volume on the headphone which is great. The biggest problem like others have mentioned is if you have small ear holes and you use the smallest tips it severely interferes with the sound quality. It makes it tinny, i even tried to buy some replacement memory foam tips but it was the same issue. Now I’ve gone back to the original tips but in honesty they’re not comfy and hurt my ears but the sound quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: ** Bex **

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones, I find it hard to find headphones that are comfortable and stay in my ears. These do both extremely well. I have tried numerous types, but none so far have come even slightly close to these. I can put these in at 7 am and they could still be in at 7 pm with no discomfort in fact I forget they are there. Yes they are expensive but the sound is amazing and the fit and comfort is on a whole different level from anything else out there. Highly recommended although a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good for fitness people, not the best sound though
customer_reviews.text: Had the product for about 25 days. The wireless nature of the Powerbeats pro after being subjected to a dongle life wasn’t enough to make me keep them. The sound quality of the product wasn’t what I was expecting. When listening to podcasts, expect to hear your surroundings since the passive noise cancelling doesn’t work that well. I assumed it was the ear tips but even after changing them around, the noise cancelling didn’t improve. Battery life is great There is little fear of these falling out It was just wasn’t for me due to noise cancelling and sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Vanish Patel

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Rubbish quality. They have a crap battery life of 4 hours. They keep disconnecting, have a mind of their own and really hard to understand. Keeps failing to connect and inconvenient. My right ear piece keeps switching off on its own. Doesn't connect easily to my laptop, rubbish microphone, and a big fat charge unit that has a crap battery life. There is no indication of battery life other than inspecting your phone. They just suddenly switch off without any verbal warning or light flashing for a dying battery, which happens all the time. I rarely write reviews, but this piece of garbage needs to be taken off the market.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed I

customer_reviews.title: You’ll be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They do stay in place which is no surprise as you have to fiddle a lot to put them on and this takes a lot of time to get used to. One of the buds didn’t always charge and you don’t get notified about it so I ended up with no sound in the left one quite a few times - and there is only one way of putting them in the charging case so I can’t be blamed for doing it incorrectly. The sound quality is ok but you’d expect more for paying this price. Item returned.
customer_reviews.author: Greg T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gym in-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: Really convenient charging case. Sturdy and provides great protection with it rattling around a gym bag. Charge it Sunday night and use it daily for work and gym and case will keep the headphones topped up until the next Sunday. Sound quality is great and latency is low due to Apple chip. Have used it with 11 Pro Max so usage with other devices (especially non iOS) will vary. Using as a a hands free is great, audio receive and send is clear. No wires to get caught. Had previously wireless headphones with a cable between the buds and would always get in the way. These provide all the freedom you need.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Gym-goers!
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are a real gamechanger; they've never fallen out of my ears while running, and sound great. Not only that, but they're probably the best looking wireless earphones on the market to. Only complain is, I have a Samsung, and obviously as they're an Apple product, they are designed to use apple customers better, but overall they're fab. Price tag's a little high too, but they're worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hamid M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good for sport
customer_reviews.text: I got these because other wireless pods don't fit my ears. Alas these also don't quite fit perfectly but the band keeps them on even in tough conditions. Sound is good (but if they fit better, it would be better). Battery life is great. Sometimes one earphone doesn't connect properly and that is annoying as you need to put them back in the box and take them out again. Tricky at first to put back in the box correctly but once you get the knack it's fine. A good buy but not quite as good as I thought they'd be.
customer_reviews.author: Hubie

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional ergonomics and sound
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable in-ear-monitors I have used to date. The over-ear arm keeps the ear tips steady and in place. Ergonomics are exceptional, especially for long distance running. Bluetooth connection is stronger than with my Cambridge Audio Melomania, with no drop-outs when connected to my Victure M3 bluetooth audio player. Sound quality is superb with plenty of bass and excellent sound quality. I was expected a lot and these have exceeded in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Pipps

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly stopped syncing with phone
customer_reviews.text: ******Update to original review -Have suddenly stopped syncing with my phone and don’t even show up available Bluetooth devices. Original review These are my 5th set of Bluetooth headphones and the most expensive by far (although I did get them via a Amazon warehouse deal). The best by miles compared to all the other brands I’ve tried. The sound has plenty of bass and doesn’t sound tinny like the others. The quality of the materials is excellent and the pause and volume buttons are sturdy and easy to use. The buds are a little painful but I imagine I’ll get used to them or buy some foam covers.
customer_reviews.author: DmB

customer_reviews.title: Quite simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly the best set of wireless earphones I have ever bought! The Bluetooth connection doesn’t drop, they fit snug in my ear and don’t move. The sound quality is fantastic... the bass line is brilliant. What’s there to not like about these? I have spent so much money on all the cheaper brands thinking they will do but these have surpassed my expectations of what they deliver. Just have to try not to loose them now!
customer_reviews.author: Mariem

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality amazing. Connectivity poor.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality for music and battery life excellent. Great for gym. However have let me down a few times when randomly one ear will stop working for no reason. Needs set up with main charging shell which I don’t carry around as so large. Also not great for calls. Callers can never hear me on these headphones. Still - great for gym and sound quality amazing.
customer_reviews.author: IAW2909

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Earphones!
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are designed to do exactly what they say. I do a lot of sports and active work and use them all day everyday, and there isn't much to dislike. The only thing, if anything, is that the sound quality isn't the best from other earphones of their price. That said, I would highly recommend them if you are doing active work/sports as they remain in place and in my experience Beats are a brand to trust for quality.
customer_reviews.author: RohanC

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy as it keeps disconnecting from the Bluetooth and switches off! Using it with iPhone XR but need to be placed in the box to restart and connect. This happens every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Naz

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The large case is cumbersome but more problematic is the total lack of noise cancellation or noise blocking. So on the tube you need to turn the volume up high just to hear. I knew they lacked noise cancellation but expected to be able to block sound more effectively when I want to. I’ve switched to the new AirPod Pros and am delighted with their fit, “transparency mode”, and noise cancellation. Plus their case is under half the size.
customer_reviews.author: Sam W. Pemberton

customer_reviews.title: Won't fall out, but won't work either, terrible
customer_reviews.text: Completely changing my review. after several months of owning them I have had nothing but issues. Headphones lose conection constantly, also when using them on my laptop they will not connect for voice sporadically. Several firmware updates later still no change. Battery life is poor compared to cheaper headphones, connectivity is terrible, app isnt great on android. Very very dissapointed and looking into trying to return.
customer_reviews.author: A B

customer_reviews.title: Power Beats
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect activity headphones if you are using an iPhone as there is a lot of integration between the Power Beats and the I OS operating system. The Bluetooth connection is almost seamless with minimum fuss, and the bass response is surprisingly deep, given the form factor of the headphones. My only issue with these Power Beats is that they become somewhat uncomfortable after about an hour or so. This was something I heard before buying them, but now I can confirm this to be the case.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great design, work superbly. Love them.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many types of earphones, for travel, for working out, for blocking out noise in the office. Nothing except over ear headphoens have worked as well as these. They are comfy at all times, dont slip or slide in the gym, are so easy to use - great design and thought has clearly gone into making them like that, very intuitive and they connect so easily to my phone. I cant say enough positive things about these. If you are womdering whether you spend this much or whether you should be more price sensitive.... you get what you pay for and in this case its top quality.
customer_reviews.author: Darren67

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality headphones that are let down by the pairing process when using Android. Every time you want to use them you have to spend about 5 minutes messing around getting them to connect to your phone; one will connect but the other won't. It is such a pain to use them that I've reduced them to a single star and am going to send them back
customer_reviews.author: Emily F.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality with these has blown my mind. I'm listening to my usual playlist of favourites and I can hear small quiet backing vocals that I never heard before in all my years of listening. I love the adjust-ability, though the instructions on doing that could be clearer - basically the top curve of the hooks that go over your ears you can just push or pull to have a secure fit. Very easy to set up and use and the packaging is gorgeous as is the charging case. I feel spoiled and like I made a great purchase. Delighted!
customer_reviews.author: Martyne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great sound and stable in the ears!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for around 10 months now and can say that they are an excellent purchase. I got them during the Black Friday deals in 2019 and although expensive I bought them on a monthly purchase plan over 5/6 months. I like to run and do HIIT sessions and these headphones don’t slip out, have great sound (especially base) and have a good battery life. Not just specific for workouts either - can be used in every day life. If willing to spend a bit extra and don’t like the headphones that drape over your head then would recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect earphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after my wireless apple ear buds kept falling out when i was running on my treadmill. The ear loop fastening works perfectly and keeps the speaker nice and tight in your ear. I am amazed at the sound quality too, loads of base and very good clarity. Perhaps a little expensive, but i think well worth the price given the quality and fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Forster

customer_reviews.title: A good alternative to air pods
customer_reviews.text: Mad expensive. But that's what is expected with beats. When listening to something and you take one out of your ear it stops the audio playing. Can be annoying. Product is kinda sleek. The case is kinda chunky. But they hold a long long charge. And are good for sport. Can be slightly uncomfortable when left in for a long time. Overall I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Poor Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with these. I bought after reading the many great reviews but sadly have now returned them. The sound quality was very poor. Perhaps I am just used to the over-ear type, but I found these to be both uncomfortable and quiet at the same time. When I put in a pair of my daughter's cheap ear phones, the volume was so much louder on the same setting.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaLee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Look great, fantastic build quality and battery life. Sometimes can sound decent. However, the sound is very hollow and tinny. Bass is poor as most professional reviews say (wish I had read them first). No noise cancellation at all. Can hear everyone's conversations and baby crying on the bus....which let's face it is why we wear headphones in the first place. Changing to the larger ear buds did help improve sound a lot, surprisingly. But still not enough. It's just the shape so they don't sit deeply in your ear canal and the angle of the buds. Might be better it they were moveable but that's more moving parts to break so i understand why not. Arranging a return.
customer_reviews.author: GAVIN JENKINS

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness earphones...
customer_reviews.text: These stay in your ears at all times. Sound quality is very good. So what’s wrong them? Well, not much to be honest. I swapped them for AirPods because you don’t know you have AirPods in your ears. Powerbeats Pro are quite large, and don’t look as good for general use. If you want a pair of earbuds purely for sport, these are the way to go. AirPods with third party ear hooks are, in my opinion, the best you can buy at the moment though - both general use and sports. I’d say Powerbeats Pro win on sound quality though - they’re a beast!
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Returned because they were really uncomfortable and the hook digs into the top of your ear. They look nice and the charger pod is sleek and stylish but honestly, they are not worth the money. If they didnt cost so much I'd of kept them and placed sponge over the hook but, for that price I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Nichola R

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Believe The Hype.
customer_reviews.text: The Powerbeats Pro are nothing but a masterclass in marketing & branding. Ignore the hype. Sound quality is more in line with the original AirPods. There is zero noise cancellation (The tech isn’t included so shouldn’t even be deemed so in certain reviews) - I could often hear outside music and other noises which ruined the experience even more so. The “in ear” buds aren’t for everyone, I wasn’t too bothered by it, but this is the way they try and reduce outside noise and to be honest; it’s nothing a set of £20 similar wireless earphones could do. All in all, I’m just not impressed. I hoped for the best, but I got a lacklustre experience.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Too much for too little
customer_reviews.text: Sadly it didn't live up to my expectations. Sound quality is average at this price was expecting so much more. I think these are overpriced based on sound quality. Also, they are not comfortable on my ears. I have medium sized average ears but after 20 mins or so I had to take them out to allow my blood to flow through my ears. These are great for people who do a lot of HIIT training fast explosive moments but I would wait for the price to drop to around 100 mark before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great connectivity and battery life, sound could be better
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go for these after experiencing poor connectivity issues with the Bose Soundsport Free Truly wireless headphones. No such connectivity issues with these, they haven't missed a beat and good compatibility with iOS. The battery life is also great. The sound is quite good, it's far from perfect, but I'm not sure the perfect headphones exists in the truly wireless area yet. These seem to be the best of the bunch so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sam McCallum

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, but....,,
customer_reviews.text: These are brilliant, I workout twice a day and quite frankly they’re the best on the market as they do not budge. The problem is I’ve had two pairs from Amazon, both faulty, hardware issue with the left bud on both pairs. I reset them numerous times did all checks I should do but they’re simply faulty. Odd thing is is when you unpack them, they smell of fungus!!! Revolting! Same on both pairs. Mine was probably a faulty batch. I do think they’re fantastic and will buy elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: D. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: It works well but left me wanting more for £219
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lows and high they are definitely more geared towards bass orientated genres however, for the price of £219 there is nothing that stands out battery life is good and stays in your ears as well as getting very loud but is not worth £219 also my left rear bud stopped connecting after 3 weeks of use sent back for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Tinny and lack any depth
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of Bose Soundsport Wireless I stupidly put in the washing machine. They seemed, on balance, to get slightly better reviews. They lasted five minutes. Whilst the functionality is better integrated with an iPhone and I have a marginal preference for the over ear clips, the sound is comparable to my daughter’s £20 JVC pair for the aeroplane - in short they are tinny, lack any bass and are actually difficult to listen too. They remind me of the old Apple wired headphones when you got water in them. Don’t waste your money. I’ve bought another pair of the Bose ones. Different league
customer_reviews.author: Mr Duncan J Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these, they are comfortable to wear, even when wearing glasses, Great sound, easy to charge , look good.
customer_reviews.author: hazel langley

customer_reviews.title: If Carlsberg made earphones!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for all purposes. I love B and O but these for working out just do what it says in the tin! I tried quiet a few different makes and models, reasonable price and great battery life. Hope this helps 💪
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Grant

customer_reviews.title: Good standard 'beats' audio but awful fit
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong these wont come out of your ears however the bud itself does not fit snug in your ear canal. This results in the bud coming out a bit and loosing all bass. Went for a 20 minute test walk, not even running and found myself constantly twisting to get the bud back in my ear. Tried all the different tips. I really wanted to like these for gym stuff with the over ear security but I just couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, fully recommended
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these. Sound quality is great, comfort is great, they are just great. You are restricted to the case too much tho, there’s no power button so these rely on the case too much which is quite annoying. I fully recommend getting these tho you will love them. They look and feel great on your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Makes you smile from ear to ear!
customer_reviews.text: This deserves 6 stars! Amazing sound quality similar to over ear headphone quality with a Bose like sound profile. Excellent connection between ear wireless bud and phone/laptop. Fast charging too!! Even an earthquake won’t budge these from your ears and so far no sweaty ear canals withers on long commutes and 10k runs
customer_reviews.author: simon b.

customer_reviews.title: THE MOST BRILLIANT WIRELSS EARPHONES ON THE MARKET
customer_reviews.text: A considered purchase but I bought it and I cannot tell you how please i am with this product. Not only does it hold in my ears during a long run ... I don't hear anything or anyone else except the music I am lost into. well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: These are brilliant. They never fall of running or come loose the charge lasts ages i use them for audio visual (zoom) classes also and they are perfect. Much better than the bose Soundsport ones i brought previously and retuned as the battery life was terrible.
customer_reviews.author: hawkibru

customer_reviews.title: WAIST OF TIME & MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: Completely dissatisfied with this product. After only 6 months One side (right) looses charge and will not re-charge once placed in the battery box. I’ve sent them back to Apple twice now for repair and the issue still is not resolved despite promises from Apple that all parts have been replaced. Apple will not provide a new pair until the faulty ones have been repaired 3 Rhône’s. DO NOT BUY THESE HEADPHONES. There are much better options like Bose and Sony that have better reviews, last longer and are more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Nadeem Sahir

customer_reviews.title: Great for active people and gym
customer_reviews.text: Great product fantastic for gym and work and any activity. Easy to set up and use love how they connect to the phone and the updates on battery life so on. Would recommend to anyone wanting headphones for work or workouts. But if it’s just for listening to music the over the ear studio ones are a much better option
customer_reviews.author: J P F

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: For £200 they are rubbish! They lose connection, they connect to your phone automatically at random points of the day. They dont charge together every time, for example you will go to use them and the left one will be flat but the right one 100% charged with them both in the case connected to the charge. ONCE AGAIN BEATS HEADPHONES ARE OVER PRICED PILE OF TERDS
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not better than Airpods
customer_reviews.text: Unless the unit I received is defective, they do not sound good at all - specially when compare to the Airpods. I take my Airpods to the gym and I am scared that they might get damaged due to sweat. So I thought I should try Powerbeats Pro. The bass is awful - immidiately putting them on I felt it. I thought something was wrong so I compared it with Airpods and the Airpods sounds much better. I had high hope :(
customer_reviews.author: Mashrur Mia

customer_reviews.title: Great for sports!
customer_reviews.text: Love these - I hope they last a long time as they are not cheap but worth the money in my opinion. I teach aerial dance and often upside down, I use these headphone as a microphone while recording tutorials for online classes. They stay in while spinning around upside down and the microphone is very clear! When using for music, they are superb! Even my husbands who is a music producer loves then too
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Great Product strongly recommended I use headphones every day. The battery life is superb last for a long time and the case is small and portable. I also tried the headphones with my Ps4 and they work perfectly, note i bought an adapter to connect to my game console.
customer_reviews.author: Yhon Soto

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Really great product. In my ear most of the day. I just use one so can still pause quickly and talk to people. Very comfortable and overall just a fantastic product. Much better than AirPods in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Christopher & Sarah White

customer_reviews.title: Awful sound quality. No bass, very tinny like an old AM radio.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these. I have the AirPods and was worried about losing them then jogging so I bought the PowerBeats Pro. They are comfortable to wear and look great. However the sound quality is extremely bad. It's hollow, high pitched and reminds me of listening to an old AM radio. I tried all the silicone buds and adjusting the ear clip but it made no difference. Not worth the high price tag. Have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’d say these are good quality headphones, and suitable for outdoor exercise. The long battery life is the biggest advantage. However, they are quite uncomfortable. The ears get used to their shape, making them less uncomfortable over time. But long listening sessions continue to be very uncomfortable. Changing earbuds makes them only slightly more bearable. The noise cancelling function also appears to be non-existent.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Saldanha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Earphones.
customer_reviews.text: These are good, they are probably the best wireless sound you can get without going for the big over ear headphones, am surprised by how much bass they can produce. Perfect for the gym, the ear hook keeps them firmly in place, volume control is good, as are are the play/skip/, volume buttons. Wish these had noise cancellation, as they get a bit noisy on train platforms or when jogging near busy roads.
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Was looking ones that fit around your ears, it's hard to get them on I think it's just shape of my ears, they are quite small, and can't wear the ones that just put in your ears. Sounds amazing. Really happy with them
customer_reviews.author: alicia paxton

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful sound quality - really surprised
customer_reviews.text: Poor sound quality, which came as a real surprise considering Beats' reputation. They sound tinny, no highs, no bass, just pure mid range and they don't go very loud either. Aside from that, they are beautifully designed and come in an amazing package. Also very comfortable. But sound quality the worst I have ever come across!
customer_reviews.author: Isawka

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, could do better otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Work well but comfort isn’t perfect for long durations. Sound cancellation is zero so even jogging induces quite a lot of wind noise. Useless when cycling (not that you should use headphones when cycling). Sound quality is good otherwise. Battery lasts a very long time. iPhone integration is very good - pairs quickly and useful battery display for the case (which charges the headphones) and individual headphones. Durability isn’t great - the ear protrusion snapped off with only minor use so have had to glue back together.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive for what they are, the left ear plug keeps cutting out and I have to re pair it with the dock to get it working. Sound is great and they sit nicely for when your running and dont move.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but....
customer_reviews.text: I liked these headphones at first until I was on the train having a bad day, so I decided to put on some Coldplay, 20 minutes later I was tapped on the shoulder but a young man asking if I was ok, I explained to him I was fine and why he would ask, then he told me he had noticed I was listening to “yellow” on repeat since I left Kilwinning, after much embarrassment I tried to explain to him that it was just an absolute tune and I was feeling it in that moment. Great for on the go... terrible for on the mend
customer_reviews.author: Marc McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Earphones for Workout
customer_reviews.text: I was using Airpods 2 prior to buying PowerBeats Pro. Being a runner and active person airpods didn’t really suit my needs . Powerbeats pro is absolute winner in this category - Ease and comfort - Excellent integration with iOS - Amazing sounds for workout - Fits my ear perfectly - Long battery life - Workouts could be sweaty by it handles it well - Stylish and Premium What I didn’t like - Noise cancelling is not there but could be something to consider
customer_reviews.author: Géo Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: Took them out of the box, have owed similar before. Spent 2 hours trying to get them to work after charging to no avail. Sent back for an exchange, will update this review once received and used the replacement set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small ears
customer_reviews.text: I have very small ears* so I was concerned that these would be too big and uncomfortable or just not fit my ears at all. With the smallest set of tips they fit perfectly and I wear them for ~6 hours continuously without a problem. The noise cancelling is exceptional, as is the sound. My only regret is not buying a pair 6 months ago when I first discovered them! * if I wear my hair up there are always random people who comment on my ears being tiny
customer_reviews.author: Richard Green

customer_reviews.title: Cons outweigh the Pros
customer_reviews.text: I miss the cable!! It’s silly things like getting a coffee, I’d just take one out and let it hang off my neck - with wireless it becomes more of a faff. Charging can be temperamental - not unusual to find that case only charged one side.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: One ear not working
customer_reviews.text: Got these just over a month ago and already the right earbud is completely dead. No sound from it and can't use the controls.
customer_reviews.author: David Wears

customer_reviews.title: Massive case and don’t charge properly
customer_reviews.text: These headphone looked very appealing, and they are good, but they’ve got some major faults, the headphone have ear hooked that can be moved to change shape, when the earbuds are placed in the charging case, they don’t charge because the contact pins do not connect properly. For this reason I am returning them, I also did not expect the charging case to bee so massive, you can’t even fit it in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for apple. Large case isn't pocketable
customer_reviews.text: These are a handy set of earbuds the battery life is too of the range but this comes at a cost. These are substantially larger then other options and heavier to enable this as well as having an extremely large case in comparison to other equivalent options. The case is deffinantly not pocketable. The sound from an iPhone was great but when paired with an android device was very disappointing. Over all of say for the price these do not stack up to.oyher top end sports options
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M

customer_reviews.title: Lovely product
customer_reviews.text: Oh my!!! I am so in love with this right now! K use it for a run, to answer calls, everything and its soo good! I love it! Only downside for me it, it gets uncomfortable after a while... maybe I need to get used to it wrapping around my ears, I dont know... also the noise cancellation is not a 100 percent, I can still hear my annoying partner speaking.... other than that, you could hear every single beat!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tulalan

customer_reviews.title: Keep your Powerbeats 3
customer_reviews.text: If you own Powerbeats 3 do not buy the Pros looking for an upgrade the audio quality is nowhere near as good also the comfort is much worse it actually hurts to where them. Save some cash and keep your Powerbeats 3
customer_reviews.author: Kurisu Makise

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Noise Cancelling makes it pretty useless for gym
customer_reviews.text: The products very comfortable, secure-fitting, water resistant and portable. However, the lack of noise cancelling just means that I can constantly hear the background EDM in my gym, and it just makes my workouts painful. This is the case with more earbuds I've realised now though, so if you want noise cancelling you'll need to get a pair of over ear headphones, like the Jlab flex sport.
customer_reviews.author: Enoka Bopitiya

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product lovely colour blue good sound and connections will definitely recommend this product unfortunately first one I had wasn’t working properly had to send it back
customer_reviews.author: Jackie p.

customer_reviews.title: Promised so much, delivered so little..
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot of reviews and recommendations (obviously sponsored!!), I bought these. I found the sound quality very poor. It’s thin and tinny and really disappointing. I was expecting so much more and especially at this price. I wouldn’t recommend them at half the price. The other features are irrelevant if the sound quality is crap. It’s back to Bose sound sport for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lee chapman

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Keeps failing to pair with any of my devices. I suspect the ones I received have been previously returned as they identify with a stranger's name. Will be returning for a refund
customer_reviews.author: alken

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well on Android
customer_reviews.text: keeps dropping out on my Sammsung pad, does not work well when switching between phone and tablet. App did not work well neither, i guess if you have Apple it will work a treat for you. Amazon returns service was very poor to respond 2 weeks in trying to return these headphones still no sign of refund!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The battery lasted only about 5 hours after a full charge, also the left earphones kept cutting out. Also the sound quality just isn’t worth the money. Very disappointed as I love Beats headphones normally.
customer_reviews.author: B Davies

customer_reviews.title: Not secure during workouts.
customer_reviews.text: In many ways these are impressive: the sound quality is good and they are easy to pair. However I wanted them for working out and running. The right earphone always works it’s way loose after about 20 mins running (but not the left one). I don’t obviously have asymmetrical ears (...!) and I’ve tried the different sized earbuds which only made it worse. I now only work out with one headphone in on the left. Bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Disgruntled

customer_reviews.title: Just buy AirPods
customer_reviews.text: Seriously just buy AirPods. Not worth the hassle, it was easier to land on the moon than change the buds - took a combined 3 people a good two days (not joking) to overcome this colossal inconvenience. I never write reviews because honestly I think they’re a waste of time - no one will read this anyways - but this is rent out of pure anger. Sounds good? Yes but not to the extent to write home about. Just get AirPods so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the two headphones are not synchronized
customer_reviews.text: I had to send back one pair because they would be often out of sync. The second ones I got are better, but still sometimes they go out of sync, which is, for their price, quite unacceptable. The case doesn't open so easily. Quality of sound is otherwise good. Battery life ok, but again... for this price...
customer_reviews.author: Lenri

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I have owned!!! Great for running. They block out the sound and do t move at all even when I sweat. Sooooo glad I bought these, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Without question the best headphones for working out. I box, and finding headphones that would stay in my ears while on the bags has been a challenge. These are a lot of money, but worth it if you have it, these feel like I’ve finally found my match
customer_reviews.author: Ric

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my birthday and I LOVE it. It’s super comfortable, it looks great, and it has all the commands you need. It is great for taking phone calls and great in any weather. (Uk weather tested)
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless Earphones
customer_reviews.text: These fit my ears very well and the sound quality is good. Sadly the battery life isn’t a lot but it’s better than normal wireless earphones. I would definitely recommend these to any adult or child because you can change the buds depending on the size of the customers ear
customer_reviews.author: JStam

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - maybe the 2nd revision will be better
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is fine , and work well. Main issue is the left ear hardly ever charges then you end up with just one ear piece. This seems to be a manufacturing fault after looking online so many others experience the same issue .
customer_reviews.author: Mr DL Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with this purchase. Great fit and great sound quality but had to return it as the one side stopped working within a few weeks. At this end of the market and at that price I expect products to near faultless.
customer_reviews.author: R Crouse

product_meta.title: Powerbeats Pro Wireless Earphones - Apple H1 headphone chip, Class 1 Bluetooth, 9 hours of listening time, Sweat resistant earbuds - Black
feature_bullets: Up to 9 hours of listening time (more than 24 hours with charging case)
Adjustable, secure-fit ear hooks for lightweight comfort and stability
Reinforced design for sweat & water resistance during tough workouts or running
Volume & track controls on each earbud, voice capability, and auto play/pause
Features the Apple H1 Headphone Chip and Class 1 Bluetooth for extended range and fewer dropouts
Enhanced phone call performance and call handling from either earbud
With fast Fuel, a 5-minute charge gives 1.5 hours of playback when battery is low
What's in the box: Powerbeats Pro totally wireless earphones, charging case, ear tips with four size options, Lightning to USB-A charging cable, quick Start guide, warranty card
